reviews.review_msg: Dr Hawkins was a really great professor. She put time into helping students and really wanted everyone to succeed. 231 is a content heavy course in itself but Dr Hawkins made the questions really straight forward and provided a good handful of practice. Keep up with material and work hard and you'll do good

Wow if I could give a 0 i would give a 0. Some teachers are truly not meant to be professors and it truly shows through her. Yeah she put an unnecessary amount of stress, worry and depression among the students. Midterm avgs were lower than they've ever been and final was much more brutal. Would be shocked if she doesn't scale with THAT avg.

Dr. Hawkins was the most considerate and caring prof that I have encountered during the pandemic. She goes through material at a relatively slow pace in lecture, taking time to explain concepts which I really appreciate. Exams are very very fair.

Nancy is great at teaching the difficult and boring stuff you want to skip by. She goes over it so it make sense and is more than willing to help if the topic does not make sense.  Going to lecture is KEY! The notes she provides via Powerpoint are great, but you need to go to fully grasp what she wants you to away from that slide.
Love, love, love her!!!

Excellent prof. Super interesting course. Final is cumulative,so study everything. Her exams are fair,well balanced,no tricks,everything straight from her notes. No textbook required to get an A. Just understand, memorize the material from notes. Pay attention b.c she gives exam clues. Downside she speaks fast so I just recorded her lectures

Super helpful but talks very fast so you get lost a lot. Don't bother buying the textbook. One thing I hated about the exams is that she makes big high mark questions out of a SINGLE slide or a single comment within that slide. So you must remember EVERYTHING and every tiny detail or you'll lose a BIG chunk. 3 midterms & 1 final which was harder

Exams were relatively strait forward. Material can get overwhelming, so keep up. She asks a few application questions which can skew your grades. The way she gives marks on exams is confusing, sometimes you get full marks other times you don't and asking doesn't help clarify why you did not receive the marks. Overall, shes a good teacher.
Nice and sweet but tests on lots of small fine detailed information such as one sentences from one lecture instead of the whole concept of the lectures.

Lectures are not recorded and she speaks pretty fast but overall I highly recommend this prof. The exams are extremely fair. Study the lecture notes and you'll be fine. The class is overall a lot of material but Nancy does a great job keeping your interest and being organized.
Very hard.  The exams do not reflect the big picture of what is taught its all about small details so memorization is key! Know absolutely everything on lecture slides or you won't get over a C.
lecture notes are organized and easy to understand. Exams are based on lecture notes

Best prof I've had yet! So knowledgeable and gets points across really well. Tests are straight out of the notes. It's ot her fault that the course has a lot of material. She presents it in clear and easy to understand manner. All you gotta do is memorize it. Plus, she is always available to help out one on one. Take this course with her =)

Great professor.  Her exams are fairly easy if you study her notes and understand them well. She's a little intimidating because she knows so much so I feel so dumb asking questions.  High energy lectures. Prof who really loves what she's doing. Definitely recommend her for all classes! One of my favorite prof!
Great professor! Her lectures are pretty interesting and it's great to see a professor who is really passionate about her course. Exams are fairly basic so studying the notes should be enough.

She is NOT an okay proff! It really depends on the person. If your the type of person that can memorize everything in the notes, then take this class. BUT if you cannot memorize every single thing on the slides, then DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! Im not good at memorization, so am not doing too well. :S
 Also, the only people that do good in her class are the ones that LOVE MBB. If you dont, then DONT TAKE IT!!!

She is one of the best profs in MBB department. She is very organized and she makes things very clear. Her review classes are super helpful in preparing midterms and final. Textbooks weren't really needed; lecture notes have all the information. Her exam touches on almost EVERYTHING so studying everyday makes a real difference!

She really knows her stuff.very interested in the stuff she teaches. midterms are a little on the harder side.Final wasn't hard but it was cumilitive and she screwed everyone up by giving a lottttttttt of questions on the first and second section material of the course.she is very organized. oh and she does not scale even one bit!

I think she's an excellent prof!  MBB courses definitely take a lot of work but if you pay super close attention to her in class, you don't even have to read the textbook.  Just review your notes and you'll do fine.  Very friendly and also approachable.

For a biochemist she knows very little about basic chemistry, and often contradicts herself in her notes.  Overall good energy, seems interested in the subject.  Tests were very fair and well-marked and she is VERY eager to help out anyone who ventures into her inconveniently timed office hours.

to those of you who complain that she is not helpful/is mean/fill-in-the-blank notes, etc. be GRATEFUL!!! she's very clear and at least the note copying keeps you awake. wait till you get Kovalyova (and her monotone) for mbb 222...THEN you'll learn to appreciate Hawkins.
No Comments

shes an alright prof. her tests are pretty fair and straight from her notes. the course only sucks cuz there is WAY too much material. MEMORIZING her notes and those relevant sections in the txtbook is the key to do well in this class.

she knows how to read out the book word by word, that's as good as her teaching goes,cut and paste 90% of the pix from text, and you gotta know everything there on. Tells people to line up and listen their names to be announced when handing back tests in a 300 person class.weird & unpleasent teacher

Tries to come off as approachable but is actually who a huge psycho, who says stuff like "Clathrin is cool" and "Look at these beautiful coil-coil motifs!" Her notes are a tad batty and don't make sense unless you pay the utmost attention in class and follow the text.

very clear explanations in class, good talking speed - and good lecture notes. a lot of reading though (not her fault-it's the course) ...but she always puts up her lecture notes online the LAST minute!!!
Great prof! Do the reading and you will be fine.

I think it's the course material that's hard, not the prof. All I can say is she is quite approachable. Go to her office at least once a week with questions about notes. Sometimes she gets into a discussion that is very helpful on exams.
No Comments
Exams are all about the lecture powerpoints.  Read them, memorize them.  There is a large volume of info to memorize, but its doable.
Tries her best to make it not boring: no mic, shouts, waves arms. Very clear. It's the sheer vol. of stuff to mememorise that kills you. Tests are fair (comp to other 221)
she consistantly puts me to sleep. her voice is annoying and her lectures are boring and unprepared.
Explainations for course content are ok....notes are directly from the text book; almost word by word, extream hardcore exams....not objective, but rather  too  comprehensive!!
SOME PEOPLE ARE NOT MADE FOR TEACHING!
She basically reads lecture notes in the class. Pretends to be nice, but when you actually deal with her face to face she is very unpleasant.
The most boring teacher I have seen. Lectures are torture. She makes an un-welcome face and stops smiling when you approach her to ask a question.
No Comments
No Comments
